description: The manual steps for re-enabling Windows Recovery Environment (WinRE) incorrectly handle the partition type needed for successful installation. When following the guidance, the instruction to 'create partition primary id=27' is crucial. Failure to maintain this partition type results in WinRE not locating an appropriate partition upon re-enabling, leading to the creation of an unwanted C:ecovery directory instead. This issue particularly affects Server 2022 Core installations, where the patch management process becomes complicated due to the inability to install updates correctly without manual registry modifications. Documentation references and troubleshooting procedures need to pay special attention to the partition type management during this process to avoid failures in WinRE installations.
